ANU.name: Lin Cui
interest: Internationalization of emerging market firmsInstitutional perspectives of International businessEntrepreneurship and international strategy
ANU.biography: Lin Cui is Professor of International business in the Research School of Management at The Australian National University. His research focuses on International business strategies and business innovation/entrepreneurship, especially of emerging economy firms. His research is published in top and leading academic journals and is highly cited. He has won major national competitive research grants in Australia and overseas. He serves on the editorial board of Journal of International Business Studies and as a senior editor of Management and Organization Review, Journal of International Management, and Asia Pacific Journal of Management.

ANDS-Grants.description: This research investigates the process by which firms from small domestic markets, such as Australia, can catch up with global market leaders through acquiring strategic assets overseas. It aims to reveal the role of the strategic intents of firm decision makers in initiating, strategising and supporting the process of competitive catch-up.
ANDS-Grants.title: Discovery Early Career Researcher Award - Grant ID: DE130100860
